channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Does playing video games make you sharper at work?
item.description: For many, picking up a controller at the end of a long day to neutralize some zombies or take on a side quest with a fairy is a way to unwind and esca...

item.title: Walmart is determined to win the Thanksgiving meal value wars with a $40 dinner for 10 people
item.description: The Butterball turkey is at its lowest price since 2019, Walmart U.S. president and CEO John Furner said.

item.title: Reid Hoffman and David Sacks Are Feuding on X Over AI and ‘Dirty Tricks’
item.description: Hoffman recently opened up to Inc. about technology’s role in politics and his vision for AI regulation.

item.title: Price of gold falls again as U.S. stocks drift near record heights
item.description: Stocks are drifting near their record heights on Wall Street Wednesday, while the price of gold falls again to trim more off its tremendous gain for t...

item.title: Great Leaders Share the Fires They’re Fighting
item.description: Being transparent about mistakes and challenges builds trust and keeps culture intact.

item.title: Meet the robots upending the wig industry
item.description: “What?!” That single word is the most frequent reaction Aasiyah Abdulsalam gets when she tells people about her company, Renatural, which makes wigs w...

item.title: How to Protect Your Company From the Worst Effects of Social Media
item.description: TikTok, Instagram, Pinterest can be huge distractions at work. Other social content can derail team collaboration.

item.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s pay hits a record $96.5 million—he got a 22% pay rise mirroring the $4 trillion tech giant’s skyrocketing shares
item.description: Satya Nadella’s pay hits its highest since becoming Microsoft CEO, driven by a 23% stock surge in 2025 and shares doubling in three years.

item.title: Anthropic’s relationship with the U.S. government is getting complicated
item.description: Anthropic insists that it’s getting along with the Trump administration just fine. In a new blog post published on October 21, the company’s CEO, Dari...

item.title: Beyond Meat and Krispy Kreme shares are soaring today as investors get the meme-stock munchies
item.description: Don’t look now, but meme stock mania appears to be back with a vengeance this week. This time around, Beyond Meat, Inc. (Nasdaq: BYND) and Krispy Krem...

item.title: Ivory Coast Gen Zers run low on patience as 83-year-old president runs for fourth term
item.description: More than three-quarters of the West African country's population is under 35.

item.title: 7 Non-Negotiable Rules for Launching a Successful Startup
item.description: Successful businesses have little or nothing to do with chance or good fortune.

item.title: Deadly floods in Mexico that killed 76 people trigger a 5-mile oil spill that could ripple through the gulf economy
item.description: The Pantepec River, where the spill occured, supplies water for a number of communities.

item.title: Apple is ‘drastically’ cutting iPhone Air production, report says, after new survey reveals ‘virtually no demand’
item.description: Production of the iPhone Air, starting next month, will be "less than 10% of the volume compared with September."

item.title: How This Serial Entrepreneur Is Making It Easier for Anyone to Build With AI
item.description: PepperMill co-founder Anh Hatzopoulos shares her advice on building successful businesses, leading teams, and getting to the IPO stage.
